justification: “In Experiment 3, we probed participants' tendency to engage in socially desirable responding using a short-form (10-item) version of the Marlowe-Crowne Social Desirability Scale.”
“To assess personal responsibility… we asked people how responsible they felt… on a scale ranging from 1 (‘Not at all responsible’) to 7 (‘Extremely responsible’).”

measured_by: fairness standards question about ‘maximum acceptable share’ (or ‘minimum acceptable share’) slider
justification: “We probed participants' fairness standards by asking them to indicate what they believed to be the ‘maximum acceptable share’ for Participant 1 to keep.”
“After participants recalled their average generosity, we asked them to rate how confident they were in their recalled generosity on a 7-point Likert scale.”

measured_by: surprise memory recall task comparing recalled vs actual average generosity
justification: “Later, in a surprise memory test, we asked participants to report how much they remembered giving on average across their five decisions… we examined the direction of participants' memory errors.”
“After making their five choices, participants… completed… a test of numeracy.”
